revised_title: Drugs in Arterial Thrombosis: An Overview of Prevention and Challenges
tldr: This article discusses the history and challenges of using drugs to prevent arterial thrombosis, specifically ischaemic heart disease. It highlights the heterogeneity of patients, pathogenetic mechanisms, and prognosis, making it difficult to demonstrate the benefits of specific drugs. The author suggests ways to improve future drug trials, such as using factorial designs and selecting homogeneous patient groups.
